title: Morph to return to television screens with 15 new episodes, Aardman creator reveals
text:
Children’s entertainment has moved on somewhat since a tiny orange clay model called Morph delighted a generation with his mischievous exploits.

But the simple animation will soon be introduced to a new audience as the impish table-top hero makes a long-awaited return to television screens.

Peter Lord, who created the character with David Sproxton, has revealed that Morph is making a comeback, with 15 five-minute episodes due to go in production.

"As we speak, back at the studio in Bristol, they're building the sets in readiness,” he told BBC Orkney.

Morph made his debut on BBC1 alongside Tony Hart in 1977 and soon won a place in the hearts of young viewers, spilling paint and interfering with the presenter’s artistic endeavours.

The character, who lived in a small wooden pencil box, would appear in short segments during Take Hart and Hartbeat after being introduced by the late artist and conversing in gobbledygook.
